cz.ive
Class IveApplication

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.IveApplication
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class IveApplication
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Container for maintaining all singletons. This is particularly usfull during save and load.

Author:
Zdenek
See Also:

classLoader

private transient java.net.URLClassLoader classLoader

stopOnEmpty

public boolean stopOnEmpty
Should we stop the simulation when the calendar gets empty?

useDAG

public boolean useDAG
Ive uses DAG to manage expressions, if useDAG is true. Use of the DAG in the trigger keeper is decided during the World load. This value will be saved along with the simulation.

noLod

public boolean noLod
If this option is true the LOD related code is bypassed. When root location the world is fully expanded

debug

public static boolean debug
GUI shows some Ive internals that are usefull for the framework debugging. This is per execution (static) variable.

logCpu

public static boolean logCpu
Log the cpu load to the log.

Constructor Detail

IveApplication

private IveApplication()
Creates new instance of this class, this can be called only from this class to ensure singleton property

Method Detail

prepareToBackup

public void prepareToBackup()
Takes references to all Singletons. This must be done before saving the simulation with simulation state STOPPED or NO_SIMULATION.

restoreFromBackup

public void restoreFromBackup()
Setups loaded instances of all Singletons. This must be done after load.

renewInstances

public void renewInstances()
Empty all Singletons, to allow load of the whole World from the XML. This must be called with simulation state STOPPED or NO_SIMULATION.

loadWorld

public void loadWorld(java.lang.String path)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Loads whole world from the XML file. The Simulation has to be in the STOPPED or the NO_SIMULATION state when calling this method.

Parameters:
path - path to the XML file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is some IO problem during the load.
java.lang.Exception - on other problems during parsing the XML and class initialization.

loadSimulation

public void loadSimulation(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Loads simulation from the specified file. The Simulation has to be in the STOPPED or the NO_SIMULATION state when calling this method.

Parameters:
path - path to the file with previously saved simulation.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is some IO problem during the load.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is some class that was not found and though can not be recreated.

saveSimulation

public void saveSimulation(java.lang.String path)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Saves simulation to the specified file. The Simulation has to be in the STOPPED or the NO_SIMULATION state when calling this method.

Parameters:
path - path to the file were the simulation should be stored.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is some IO problem during the save.

instance

public static IveApplication instance()
Getter for IveApplication singleton

Returns:
singleton of this class

loadIveClass

public java.lang.Class<?> loadIveClass(java.lang.String className)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Loads class specified by the given name.

Parameters:
className - Name of the class to be loaded.
Returns:
loaded class
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when the class is not in the path.

addClassPathURL

public void addClassPathURL(java.net.URL url)
Appends new url, to the list of the classpath urls.

Parameters:
url - URL where to look for the classes.

getIveResourceAsStream

public java.io.InputStream getIveResourceAsStream(java.lang.String path)
Locates the resource using the Ive class loader.

Parameters:
path - Path to the reource inside the package hierarchy.
Returns:
Specified resource as an InputStream.

getIveClassLoader

protected java.lang.ClassLoader getIveClassLoader()
Retrieves (and initializes if necessary) the classloader.

Returns:
Class loader with the extended classpath.

writeObject

private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream s)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Writes out the IveApplciation into the object stream. We write the custom uri list first.

Parameters:
s - stream to be filled with description of this object
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readObject

private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream s)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Loads contents of this object from the object stream. There is a hack, because we must load id before everything else if we are instance of IveIdImpl.

Parameters:
s - stream to be used to load the description of this object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

printStackTrace

public static void printStackTrace(java.lang.Throwable exc)
Print stack trace of the given exception. This method does nothing, when the application is not run in the debug mode.

Parameters:
exc - Exception to be stackTraced
